title: Connelly's 25 favorite games: How they went down and what they mean
content: From A&M's historic comeback to heart-stoppers at all levels, Week 12 was packed with games to remember.

title: Purdue reclaims No. 1; Louisville, Illini into top 10
content: Purdue and Houston again swapped spots, as the Boilermakers returned to No. 1 in the AP Top 25 men's college basketball poll while Louisville and Illinois entered the top 10.

title: Sources: Penix expected to miss rest of season
content: Falcons quarterback Michael Penix Jr. is not expected to play again this season as a result of the knee injury he suffered during Sunday's loss to the Panthers, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Source: Carter slept through Giants' workout
content: Abdul Carter was benched for the Giants' opening series Sunday because he was asleep at the team facility and missed a recent walk-through, a source told ESPN.

title: Ex-UNO player admits to point-shaving scheme
content: Former University of New Orleans men's basketball player Dae Dae Hunter has acknowledged his role in a point-shaving scheme last season.

title: Mbappé ups PSG compensation claims to $300M
content: The legal dispute between Paris Saint-Germain and Kylian Mbappé escalated on Monday with both sides making colossal financial demands.

title: Grizzlies' Morant (calf) to miss at least 2 weeks
content: The Grizzlies announced Monday that star guard Ja Morant suffered a Grade 1 right calf strain in the first quarter of Saturday's loss at Cleveland and will miss at least two weeks.

title: Prosecutor: A. Brown could face 30 years if guilty
content: Former NFL star wide receiver Antonio Brown could face up to 30 years in prison if convicted of attempted murder because a firearm was allegedly used, a prosecutor said Monday.

title: The Chiefs aren't broken -- but they could miss the playoffs: Barnwell on what has gone wrong
content: The Chiefs are 5-5 after losing to the Broncos. They're third in the AFC West, and ESPN's FPI has them at 55.4% to make the playoffs. Is it time to worry?

title: Fixing the Mavs: Why there's no cure-all for this Dallas disaster
content: Can this mess be fixed? Our NBA insiders are breaking down the Mavs' options amid a tumultuous 4-10 start.

title: Let's overreact to NFL Week 11: MVP for Josh Allen? Sack record for Myles Garrett?
content: Is Allen a prime MVP candidate again? Has the AFC West torch been passed? We overreact to Week 11, plus fantasy football takes.

title: A weekend with the banana suits and shirtless fans surviving Oklahoma State
content: It has been a bad year for the Pokes. It hasn't stopped their fans from making their own bright spots.

title: Grading bold season predictions for all 30 MLB teams
content: It's time to see if what we said about each club going into the season was accurate or not -- and what it means for 2026.

title: From Josh McDaniels to Dan Campbell: What has gone right, wrong for every NFL OC, playcaller this season
content: NFL Nation reporters break down the good and bad for each OC/playcaller and peg the key to success the rest of the season.

title: Players react to efforts to halt team report cards: 'Pushback shows it's working'
content: NFL players who spoke to ESPN say the report cards are making a tangible impact on workplace conditions.

title: 'I'm probably going to cry': Inside DeMarvion Overshown's long journey back from knee surgery
content: Overshown's breakout 2024 season for Dallas was cut short by a horrendous knee injury. Here's how he fought his way back.

title: Raiders offense was meant to make strides under Kelly, but the opposite has occurred
content: From national champion and Pro Bowler to ... league-worst offense? What's next for Chip Kelly and Geno Smith.

title: The NHL's best this week: How the Devils move forward minus Jack Hughes
content: One of the game's elite players will be out eight weeks for a division leader. Plus, a look at the week's key games.

title: Paul vs. Joshua: Everything you need to know
content: How did the fight come together? What does this fight mean for Paul, Joshua? Andreas Hale answers this questions and more.

title: Buzz: Who got the ball on Sunday?
content: Look beyond yards and touchdowns to determine who has the opportunity to score future fantasy points.

title: 2026 World Cup: Ukraine keep World Cup hopes alive with clinched playoff spot
content: The race to qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup is drawing to a close. Here's how it's looking around the globe.

title: How Norway sealed first World Cup spot since 1998
content: With the likes of Erling Haaland and Martin Ødegaard, Norway are ready to make an impact on the big stage.

title: AP Top 25 poll Week 2 reaction: New No. 1, Louisville climbs
content: The second in-season men's AP Top 25 poll for 2025-26 is out. Here's what next for every team in the standings.

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: UConn remains No. 1, Michigan on the rise
content: The second in-season women's AP Top 25 poll is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

title: UFC 322 fight grades: Shevchenko, Makhachev were good but boring
content: Back-to-back-to-back knockouts gave the UFC 322 main card life, but the title bouts cooled things off.

title: Early bets for Week 12: Bears to cover at home, Saints to pull off upset among plays
content: What lines offered immediate value once odds came out? Here are five early bets to consider going into Week 12.

title: 'I didn't spit on nobody': Bengals WR Ja'Marr Chase's leads Week 11's top quotes
content: Week 11 of the NFL season brought its fair share of memorable quotes, led by Bengals wide receiver Ja'Marr Chase.

title: The blueprint to the 76ers lineups when Embiid is in or out
content: Andre Snellings does a deep dive on which players to start on the 76ers, depending on their lineup for the day.

title: Man United's plan: Save millions in wages, rebuild midfield
content: Next summer looms as a busy transfer period for Manchester United: More than £1 million in wages will be offloaded, which will in turn free up space for some major midfield upgrades.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Grimaldo amid major changes to squad
content: Barcelona are looking for reinforcements at left back, right back and on the wing. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Delhi car blast probe: Suicide bomber Umar disappeared for 10 days before blast — this is where he hid
content: Security agencies have identified a rented house in Nuh's Hidayat Colony used by Delhi blast accused Umar Un Nabi. The owner is in jail, and the accommodation was allegedly arranged via an electrician. CCTV footage and local inquiries are being used to trace his movements and activities during his 10-day stay.

title: From PM to exile to death sentence: How Sheikh Hasina’s fortunes changed in a year
content: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has been sentenced to death in absentia by a tribunal she helped establish. The International Crimes Tribunal found her guilty of inciting violence and ordering lethal force during last year's student-led protests. Hasina, now in exile in India, has denounced the verdict as politically motivated, while Dhaka seeks her extradition.

title: Chandrayaan-4 mission: Isro locks 2028 target; plans ambitious lunar sample return
content: India's Chandrayaan-4 lunar sample-return mission, a complex joint effort with Japan, is slated for a 2028 launch. This initiative aims to explore lunar resources and develop crucial operational technologies. Concurrently, ISRO is progressing with its manned lunar mission target of 2040 and the Bharatiya Antariksha Station by 2035.

title: Delhi car blast case: NIA arrests detained Kashmiri student, suspect's father sets himself ablaze
content: The National Investigation Agency has arrested Jasir Bilal Wani from Srinagar. He is linked to Delhi suicide bomber Umar Un Nabi. Wani's father died after setting himself ablaze. Investigations reveal Wani provided technical support for terror attacks. He allegedly modified drones and attempted to make rockets. The NIA is continuing its search for all involved in the bombing.

title: IND vs SA: Gill's condition remains doubtful; India summon Nitish Kumar Reddy ahead of Guwahati Test
content: Nitish Kumar Reddy is set to rejoin India's Test squad for the second match against South Africa in Guwahati. He was previously released for India A fixtures to gain game time.

title: Jeff Bezos is taking up a new 'CEO job' and it's not with Amazon
content: Jeff Bezos is back in a formal leadership role. He is co-chief executive of a new AI startup called Project Prometheus. The company has secured a massive $6.2 billion in funding. Project Prometheus aims to revolutionize manufacturing and engineering. It will focus on AI for sectors like aerospace and automotive. Top talent from OpenAI, DeepMind, and Meta have joined the startup. This venture marks Bezos's first operational role since leaving Amazon.

title: Student surge in US: India retains top spot; 2024-25 enrolment jumps 10%
content: India continues its reign as the top source of international students in the US, with a 10% increase to over 3.6 lakh students. Despite global dips and visa concerns, Indian students' presence is strong, contributing significantly to the US economy. Undergraduate numbers saw a rise, while graduate enrolments dipped slightly, though OPT surged.

title: Cooked! Under pressure from Trump, India to buy LPG from US citing demand fired up by Ujjwala
content: India has secured a landmark one-year contract to purchase 2.2 million tonnes of LPG from the United States, marking its first structured deal for American gas. This move diversifies India's energy sources, with major state-run oil companies set to handle the imports starting January 2026.

title: Nvidia export loophole: Chinese firm taps Jakarta pipeline; Blackwell chips bypass curbs
content: Despite US export bans, Chinese AI firms are acquiring Nvidia's advanced chips through complex international routes. A recent deal saw thousands of Blackwell chips reach Jakarta, destined for a Chinese company, via a US subsidiary and an Indonesian telecom provider. This workaround highlights significant gaps in US technology control strategy, alarming national security officials who fear military applications. Nvidia's CEO has voiced concerns about the economic impact of these restrictions on American businesses.

title: ‘Imagine it falling into children’s hands’: SC flags risky whisky tetra packs; questions state nod
content: The Supreme Court expressed concern over states permitting liquor sales in small tetra packs, likening them to juice containers and highlighting potential risks to children. This issue emerged during a trademark dispute between whisky producers Allied Blenders and John Distillers, where tetra packs constitute a significant portion of sales in some regions.

title: HC delay order slammed: SC raps MP court; flags breach of judicial discipline
content: The Supreme Court has expressed strong disapproval of High Courts disregarding its rulings and judicial precedent. Justices J B Pardiwala and K V Viswanathan questioned how the Madhya Pradesh High Court could condone a nearly five-year delay by the state government in filing an appeal, emphasizing the need for judicial discipline and adherence to established legal principles.

title: Is Giannis playing tonight vs Cavaliers? Latest update on Bucks star’s injury
content: Bucks fans can breathe a sigh of relief as Giannis Antetokounmpo is probable for tonight's crucial game against the Cavaliers. Despite injuries on both sides, Giannis's expected return is a major boost for Milwaukee, seeking stability with an 8-6 record. His stellar performance, averaging over 32 points, is vital against a depleted Cleveland squad.

title: How to send WhatsApp messages without saving a contact on your phone
content: WhatsApp allows users to initiate chats without saving contacts by using Click to Chat links or the official "Chat on WhatsApp" button. This feature streamlines communication for temporary interactions and business inquiries, offering flexibility on both mobile and web platforms. Users can create custom links with pre-filled messages for added convenience.

title: Maharashtra civic polls: SC warns on breaching 50% quota cap; threatens to stall nominations
content: The Supreme Court has mandated that total reservations for SC, ST, and OBCs in Maharashtra civic body elections must not exceed 50%. The court warned it would halt the nomination process in constituencies breaching this limit. Elections will proceed based on pre-July 2010 OBC reservation norms, as the Banthia Commission's report is not yet finalized.

title: 'Remain vigilant': MEA's advisory for Indians as Iran suspends visa-waiver
content: Iran has suspended its visa-waiver facility for Indian passport holders starting November 22, 2025, following incidents where Indians were lured with false job promises and subsequently kidnapped for ransom. The Ministry of External Affairs advises vigilance against agents offering such arrangements. This action aims to curb the misuse of the visa-free entry for criminal activities.

title: 'India, Russia finalising new pacts': Jaishankar meets Lavrov in Moscow; Putin to visit Delhi in Dec
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar's Moscow visit focused on high-level discussions ahead of President Putin's India trip. Discussions covered bilateral ties, regional stability including Ukraine, and preparations for the upcoming annual summit. Both nations anticipate significant outcomes to deepen their "Special and Privileged Strategic Partnership."

title: Who Is Marco Acortes? Mystery Man Behind Viral 2013 Coronavirus Tweet
content: An obscure tweet from 2013 by online creator Marco Acortes, stating "Corona virus….its coming," gained widespread attention in 2020 when COVID-19 emerged. The post, which has not been edited, resurfaced again in 2025, sparking speculation about Acortes's prescience. He has since ceased all social media activity, leaving his current whereabouts and the inspiration behind the tweet a mystery.

title: Candace Owens Sparks Furor With New Britney Trafficking Claim as Lou Taylor
content: Britney Spears shared a heartwarming Instagram video with Kim and Khloé Kardashian, sparking viral attention. Simultaneously, Candace Owens leveled serious accusations on her podcast, alleging Lou Taylor's manipulative control over Britney and other stars, citing an insider email and historical patterns of financial and media exploitation. Owens' claims, though unproven, have ignited significant discussion.

title: Kayla Nicole Accused of AI-Generated Apology as Internet Breaks It Down
content: Kayla Nicole faces renewed online backlash over decade-old offensive tweets. Her subsequent apology has ignited a debate, with accusations of using AI to craft her statement. Critics question the sincerity of her remorse, while others argue the focus should be on her growth and acknowledging past harm, not AI detection.

title: 'Precautionary decision': Two SL cricketers return from Pak before tri-series
content: Sri Lanka's T20 tri-series campaign faces a setback as captain Charith Asalanka and fast bowler Asitha Fernando are returning home due to illness. The board termed the move precautionary, ensuring their recovery. Dasun Shanaka will lead the team in Asalanka's absence. Pavan Rathnayake has been added to the T20I squad as a replacement.

title: Klay Thompson on Megan Thee Stallion shooting as case gets $20k boost
content: In a twist of courtroom drama, rapper Tory Lanez finds himself facing a hefty $20,000 fine for contempt after dodging questions during a deposition for Megan Thee Stallion's slander lawsuit against Milagro Gramz. This setback comes on the heels of a denied appeal in the shooting case involving Megan, as things heat up during jury selection for her defamation battle.

title: Delhi car blast: 'Madam Surgeon' emerges as key player; diaries hint at 'D-6 Mission'
content: Investigators are unraveling a sophisticated Jaish-e-Mohammed plot, allegedly masterminded by Dr. Shaheen Shahid, dubbed "Madam Surgeon." The module, involving Kashmiri doctors, planned coordinated strikes and a December 6th attack to "avenge" the Babri Masjid demolition. Financial trails and overseas meetings with ISI handlers are under scrutiny.

title: Travis Kelce confronts much shorter Broncos defender in fiery on field clash
content: Kansas City's Travis Kelce and Denver's Ja'Quan McMillian clashed on the field during Sunday's game. The heated exchange occurred after McMillian made a hard tackle on Kelce, leading to a face-to-face confrontation. This incident added significant intensity to the already fierce rivalry between the Chiefs and Broncos, highlighting the high stakes and physical nature of their matchups.

title: Shocking trades! 'Mohammed Shami to LSG surprised me, Andre Russell release is 'risky'
content: Former India spinner Amit Mishra shared his views on IPL 2026 retention day moves. He found Mohammed Shami's trade to Lucknow Super Giants surprising. Releasing Andre Russell into the auction pool was also termed a risky decision. Mishra also commented on Mayank Yadav's retention and Ravi Bishnoi's potential return to LSG at a lower price.

title: France-Ukraine arms deal: Paris to supply 100 Rafale jets to Kyiv - what it means
content: France and Ukraine have signed a significant defense pact, potentially including up to 100 Rafale fighter jets, drones, and advanced air defense systems over a decade. President Macron emphasized long-term support, while President Zelenskyy hailed the agreement as historic amidst ongoing Russian advances and domestic reforms. Deliveries are planned post-conflict, underscoring the need for a strong Ukrainian army.

title: Ashes: Bodyline, Bradman, Botham, Stokes - A look at 5 iconic series between Australia and England
content: England and Australia will start the new Ashes series in Perth on Friday, stepping into a rivalry that has carried its own history for more than a century. England arrive with a clear target: to take back the urn for the first time since 2015. The article revisits five memorable series, highlighting iconic moments like Ben Stokes' Headingley heroics in 2019 and England's narrow 2005 victory.

title: Sai Sudarshan or Devdutt Padikkal - Who should replace Shubman Gill in Guwahati Test?
content: India's Test captain Shubman Gill's neck spasm casts doubt on his participation in the second Test against South Africa. Former spinner Anil Kumble suggests Sai Sudharsan as a potential replacement if Gill is unfit, while also noting Devdutt Padikkal as another batting option. India aims to avoid a series defeat after their Kolkata loss.

title: Ja’Marr Chase Faces Possible Suspension After Spitting on Jalen Ramsey
content: A controversial on-field incident between the Bengals and Steelers has put star receiver Ja'Marr Chase's Week 12 availability in doubt. While Steelers cornerback Jalen Ramsey was ejected for punching Chase, video evidence suggests Chase may have provoked the altercation by spitting. The NFL is reviewing the matter, with a suspension a strong possibility given league precedent for such actions.

title: Trump tariff shock eases? India’s exports to US rise after 4 months of slide
content: Indian exports to the US saw a monthly uptick in October, a positive sign despite hefty tariffs. However, year-on-year figures reveal a notable decline compared to last October. Overall, India's aggregate exports faced a significant dip, with only a few key markets showing growth, while imports surged due to precious metal purchases.

title: Lost Rs 32cr in 6 months: Bengaluru techie fell for ‘digital arrest’ scam
content: A Bengaluru woman lost nearly Rs 32 crore in a sophisticated "digital arrest" scam. Posing as CBI officers, fraudsters subjected her to constant Skype surveillance, threatening immediate arrest. Over six months, she made 187 bank transfers, believing she was proving her innocence, before receiving a fake clearance letter.

title: Ayesha Curry Shares Baby Cai Moments as Stephen Curry Extends Warriors’ Streak
content: Ayesha Curry has put an end to marriage rumors by sharing heartwarming glimpses of her family life on Instagram. While Stephen Curry leads the Golden State Warriors, Ayesha enjoyed a relaxed weekend with their children, featuring adorable moments with baby Cai and cooking classes with Riley. The photos highlight precious family time amidst Stephen's demanding NBA schedule.

title: When and how you can see the 2025 Leonid meteor shower in November 2025
content: The 2025 Leonid meteor shower peaks on November 16-17, offering a prime viewing opportunity with a thin crescent moon and dark skies. Originating from comet 55P/Tempel-Tuttle, these fast-moving meteors will be visible from dark locations, with moderate activity expected. Scientists utilize these events for research into debris streams and atmospheric studies.

title: India-US trade deal soon? First tranche near closure! Would be 'highly detailed'
content: India and the US are nearing a trade deal, addressing reciprocal and oil tariffs. Discussions are underway to finalize a package including US market access and tariff adjustments. Officials indicate negotiations are largely complete, with a resolution expected soon.

title: 'Sab darr ke khel rahe hain': Mohammad Kaif hits out after 93 all out
content: Mohammed Kaif believes selection uncertainty under Gautam Gambhir is hindering India's Test batters at home. He cited the exclusion of Sai Sudharsan and Sarfaraz Khan's inconsistent selection despite good performances, suggesting players are fearful and lack backing. This instability was highlighted after India's loss to South Africa in the first Test.

title: EC orders 'Special Revision' of Assam voter list, final roll in Feb; how it differs from SIR
content: The Election Commission has ordered a Special Revision of Assam's electoral rolls, with January 1, 2026, as the qualifying date and the final list due February 10, 2026. This focused update aims for accuracy, falling between routine and intensive revisions. The process involves door-to-door verification by BLOs using pre-filled registers.

title: Tax refunds: CBDT flags wrongful claims; why high-value payouts are stuck
content: The Income-Tax Department is withholding some high-value refund payments due to detected wrongful deduction claims in flagged filings. Legitimate refunds are expected to be cleared this month or by December, while the department is also working to reduce direct tax litigation and has seen a significant increase in appeal disposals.

title: Sheikh Hasina sentenced to death: Can she challenge the verdict? A look at possible scenarios
content: Bangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal has sentenced ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to death for crimes against humanity. Found guilty of ordering killings and inciting violence during a student uprising, Hasina can appeal the verdict within sixty days. India may refuse extradition if the charges are deemed political, adding to Bangladesh's political uncertainty.

title: Narayana Murthy points to China’s 9-9-6 rule to justify 72-hour work weeks
content: A debate on work-life balance is reignited in India. Infosys founder N. R. Narayana Murthy suggested young Indians adopt a 72-hour work week. This sparked immediate backlash from workers citing long commutes, rising expenses, and constant after-hours communication. Employees emphasize that current long hours do not yield better results. They seek fair pay, predictable hours, and time for rest.

title: Delhi blast: NIA nabs ‘active co-conspirator’; accused provided tech support, tried to make rockets
content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested Jasir Bilal Wani, a key associate of the terrorist involved in the Red Fort car blast. Wani allegedly provided technical support by modifying drones and attempting to make rockets. This arrest follows the apprehension of another aide who facilitated the car's purchase, bringing the NIA closer to uncovering the conspiracy.

title: ‘Prioritise passion over perfection,’ says AI godmother Fei-Fei Li: What professionals need to know
content: Fei-Fei Li, Stanford professor and CEO of World Labs, urged young AI professionals to focus on passion, mission, and meaningful impact rather than overanalyzing technical details or credentials. Emphasizing creativity, adaptability, and alignment with teams, Li’s guidance highlights the importance of soft skills and long-term vision in building a successful AI career, echoing global industry perspectives.

title: Pakistan camp goes berserk after beating India A; clip goes viral – Watch
content: Mohammad Faiq and Maaz Sadaqat — who finished unbeaten and carried Pakistan home — were visibly fired up as they headed back to the dugout. High-fives, roars and bear hugs followed as the players celebrated the emphatic result.

title: Saudi bus crash: Death toll rises to 45; CM announces ex-gratia of Rs 5L - top developments
content: A devastating bus fire near Medina in Saudi Arabia has claimed the lives of 45 Umrah pilgrims from Telangana, with only one survivor. The blaze spread rapidly, preventing most passengers from escaping the tragedy. This incident marks one of the most severe overseas accidents involving pilgrims from the state in recent years.

title: West Bengal school recruitment scam: ‘Tainted’ candidates have made it to the fresh interview list, allege teachers
content: Fresh protests erupted in Kolkata ahead of the interview as many ‘untainted’ teachers who lost their jobs after the Supreme Court order cry foul

title: School children move Delhi HC seeking rescheduling of outdoor sports to months with safer air quality
content: The petition states that the children, who actively participate in zonal, inter-zonal, state and national sporting activities, are being forced to engage in strenuous physical exertion in “a highly toxic environment”

title: Delhi CM targets Punjab over stubble burning; air quality continues to be ‘very poor’
content: The Delhi CMO said that Ms. Gupta said that states like Haryana, Rajasthan, and Uttar Pradesh have shown positive progress in crop-residue management in recent years, but the volume of smoke coming from Punjab remains significantly high

title: In 2024-25, India remained leading place of origin of international students in U.S.: Report
content: The U.S. State Department sponsored report showed that total international students in U.S. went up by 5% in 2024-24, and new enrolments went down by about 7%

title: Madhya Pradesh government revokes land pooling scheme for permanent Kumbh city in Ujjain amid farmers’ protest
content: The decision to repeal the scheme comes amid protests from various farmer organisations and before a major agitation in Ujjain on Tuesday (November 18, 2025); the Bharatiya Kisan Sangh has called back the agitation

title: More women enrol in defence and strategic studies course in University of Madras over the past few years
content: The course offers an array of topics that shapes the students’ strategic thought on national security and offers subjects including specialised warfare, conflict resolution, arms control and disarmament, and fundamentals of national security

title: T.N. Council of Historical Research invites applications for fellowship
content: The fellowship entails conducting in-depth and exhaustive research on the history of Tamil Nadu extracted from archival records in the State

title: In ‘unusual intervention’, SC forbids grant of bail to accused in digital arrest case
content: Justice Surya Kant said such cases of deception of senior citizens deserve “unusual orders”. “We have to deal with these cases sternly so that the right message is sent,” he said

title: ‘Indian Muslims no longer fear SIR, did not fall in Mamata’s trap’: West Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari
content: Trinamool Congress spokesperson retorts saying that the people of West Bengal are severely disgruntled with SIR; AI likely to be used to scan duplicacies in electoral roll, sources in CEO’s office say

title: India, Russia looking at finalising new pacts, initiatives during Putin's visit to New Delhi
content: As part of the preparations for the visit, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday, November 17, held extensive talks in Moscow with his Russian counterpart Sergey Lavrov.

title: Poll petition: M. Swaraj withdraws appeal before SC
content: Mr. Swaraj had earlier approached the Kerala High Court, alleging that his rival candidate had canvassed votes on religious grounds

title: Delhi blast culprits will get strictest punishment: Amit Shah
content: Under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, eliminating terrorism from its roots is our collective commitment, says Shah at Northern Zonal Council meet

title: Father of accused Kulgam youth succumbs to injuries
content: The victim, a dry fruit seller by profession, was also detained for questioning by the police a few days ago, locals said

title: Cashew scam: Kerala HC slams State govt for denying nod for CBI probe
content: The High Court asked if the government’s stance on combating corruption was undermined by its protection of those facing serious allegations.

title: ‘We’ll engage with all stakeholders’ in Bangladesh, says India after Sheikh Hasina verdict
content: “India has noted the verdict announced by the Tribunal concerning former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. As a close neighbour, India remains committed to the best interests of the people of Bangladesh,” the Ministry of External Affairs says

title: 27 lakh MGNREGS deletions an attempt to deny rural poor right to work: Congress
content: Jairam Ramesh cites The Hindu report on deletion of 27 lakh MNREGS workers in a month and calls it another step towards dismantling the scheme

title: RJD reviews results; Tejashwi made Legislature Party leader
content: The party meeting to review the debacle in the Assembly election included discussions on the anger of local leaders who were dropped, and mistakes in ticket distribution and the selection of candidates

title: Telangana to join nationwide anti-drug pledge as Excise dept. highlights major seizures over 5 years
content: State government has instructed schools, colleges, women’s groups, anganwadi workers and Auxiliary Nurse Midwives across Telangana to administer the pledge simultaneously at 11.30 a.m.

title: Kerala to observe World AMR Awareness Week
content: Bid to improve awareness and understanding of antimicrobial resistance and encourage best practices among the public

title: Political parties question handling of seized explosives by J&K police
content: The accidental explosion inside the Nowgam police station in Srinagar on the night of November 14 left nine dead and 32 injured

title: India-China ties improving, says Army Chief
content: The Army Chief said Operation Sindoor was “just a trailer that ended in 88 hours”. “If Pakistan gives a chance, we will teach it how to behave responsibly with a neighbouring nation,” said Gen. Dwivedi

title: Arrested Pune engineer preached anti-democracy ideology: Maharashtra ATS
content: Zubair had links with terror group al-Qaeda, and was preaching to youth that “democracy is against Shariat” and created content on topics, including Jihad and “Ghazwa-e-Hind”, the takeover of Indian subcontinent by a Caliphate

title: Centre reviewing Supreme Court ruling on forest laws and tribal housing, says Minister
content: Tribal Affairs Minister Jual Oram said “we need to ensure that flagship programmes like PM-JANMAN and DAJGUA continue to serve our tribal communities effectively”

title: Kuki-Zo MLAs say no decision taken about joining popular government in Manipur
content: The statement came after a section of media, on Monday (November 17, 2025) reported that all the 10 Kuki-Zo MLAs have decided to join a popular government in place of the existing President's rule

title: Incessant rains may bring India’s coffee output down by 30,000 tonnes: KPA
content: Over 2,000 coffee growers in Karnataka’s Kodagu, Hassan and Chikmagaluru may have an estimated loan outstanding of ₹400 crore to ₹500 crore

title: Reconsider location of 184-feet high Lord Murugan statue, Madras High Court tells Marudhamalai temple management
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar & D. Bharatha Chakravarthy say, the stress that could be caused to the ecology due to proximity to reserve forests must be taken into account

title: No rain in A.P. despite orange alert for Nellore, Tirupati
content: IMD expects light to moderate rain in SCAP and Rayalaseema over the next four days; fresh low-pressure area likely over southeast Bay of Bengal on November 22

title: Stray dog menace leaves walkers worried
content: Full-fledged infrastructure, proper vaccination of dogs, consistent ABC, resources and manpower are needed to control dog population, say experts

title: Few takers for online SIR enumeration forms in Ernakulam
content: As of 12 noon on November 17, 2025, only 3,503 voters in the district had submitted their enumeration forms online, according to official data

title: Puttaparthi gears up for Sathya Sai Baba centenary celebrations
content: Trust outlines extensive arrangements as Prime Minister Modi, President Murmu and top leaders to visit Prasanthi Nilayam this week

title: Youth Congress stages protest in Hyderabad over ‘vote-tampering’ by BJP in collusion with EC
content: Youth Congress workers staged a dramatic depiction of PM Modi and national Election Commissioner Ganesh Kumar to highlight what they called a BJP-EC nexus enabling electoral manipulation

title: Cabinet gives its nod to Gig and Platform Workers draft Bill
content: Act provides for registration of Gig and Platform workers enabling them to avail benefits of government schemes

title: Kerala University V-C postpones Syndicate meeting, citing lack of security on campus
content: Kunnummal criticises the police for allegedly yielding to political pressure and failing to provide him adequate protection during a confrontation where his car was obstructed by protesters

title: Tickets on trains to Kerala sold out well ahead of Christmas-New Year season
content: When the booking site is opened, a ‘regret message’ pops up prompting the user to explore other means to transportation

title: Form expert committee to discuss sugarcane issue, State govt. told
content: Viresh Sobaradmath Swami has said that the State govt. should look into the issues concerning sugarcane growers, sugar mills and resolve them

title: Tamil Nadu archaeologists join excavations at Berenike in Egypt to trace ancient Mediterranean trade links
content: In 1995, archaeologists unearthed a potsherd at Berenike bearing the Tamil-Brahmi text korrapuman. The TNSDA has joined the current season of excavations at the ancient port city on the Red Sea coast to identify more evidence of ancient trade links between the Tamils and the Romans

title: India pitches digital solidarity at global telecom meet in Baku
content: Pemmasani Chandra Shekhar highlights India’s low-cost, large-scale digital model, fastest 5G rollout and robust anti-fraud systems, urging nations to build trusted and inclusive digital ecosystems

title: Sugarcane growers stage rasta roko in Kalaburagi
content: They are demanding a Fair and Remunerative Price of ₹5,500 per tonne of sugarcane based on 9.50% recovery rate and uniform price across State

title: Minister assures to resolve major issues in Nellore
content: The MA&UD Minister lays foundation stone for the construction of new road works at Sunday Market and at underbridge near Atmakur Bus Stand in the city

title: Netanyahu Slams Violence By "Extremists" Among Israeli West Bank Settlers
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu condemned the violence of a "handful of extremists" among Israeli settlers in the occupied West Bank, following clashes and attacks on Monday.

title: Ukrainian Defence Firm Names Ex-US Official Mike Pompeo To Advisory Board
content: A leading Ukrainian drone and missile manufacturer said that it has named former US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo to its newly launched advisory board, a move aimed at tightening oversight while it is investigated by anti-corruption authorities.

title: Sheikh Hasina Verdict Highlights: "No One Above Law" - Yunus On Verdict Against Sheikh Hasina
content: The former Bangladesh PM was found guilty of ordering a deadly crackdown on student-led protests last year.

title: AI To Create More Jobs Than It Eliminates By 2027: Report
content: Artificial intelligence is expected to transform the global workforce in the coming years as by 2027 AI will create more jobs than it eliminates, a new report said on Monday.

title: 22-Year-Old Man Killed After Brawl Over Bihar Poll Verdict, 2 Arrested
content: An argument triggered by political discussions over the Bihar poll verdict resulted in the killing of a 22-year-old man allegedly by his maternal uncles in Guna district of Madhya Pradesh, police said on Monday.

title: Siddaramaiah's Wife In Hospital Over Respiratory Issues
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's wife Parvathi B M has been admitted to a private hospital with complaints of respiratory problems, family sources said on Monday.

title: Adani Enterprises Wins Golden Peacock Award For ESG Excellence
content: Adani Enterprises Limited (AEL), the flagship company of the Adani Group, has been honoured with the prestigious Golden Peacock Award for Excellence in Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) - 2025 by the Institute of Directors (IOD).

title: India-Russia Ties Factor Of Stability In International Relations: S Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar said on Monday that India-Russia ties have long been a factor of stability in international relations.

title: In BJP's 'Mission Bengal', Different Strategies To Be Anchored By Top Leaders
content: After the huge win in the Bihar election, the BJP has started working on a strategy to break through the defensive lines of West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee and her Trinamool Congress.

title: Saudi Arabia Bus Accident Highlights: 42 Indians Dead In Saudi Arabia After Bus Accident, PM Modi, Vice President Express Condolences
content: Saudi Arabia Accident Highlights: Tragedy struck near Medina, Saudi Arabia on Monday where 42 Indian Umrah pilgrims are dead following a devastating collision between a bus and a tanker.

title: 'Ask An Astrologer': DK Shivakumar On Karnataka Leadership Change Query
content: "What is wrong with having aspirations?" was Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar's response when asked about several Congress legislators openly expressing their desire to be included in the state cabinet.

title: Top Court Restrains Courts From Releasing Accused In 'Digital Arrest' Fraud
content: In a rare move, the Supreme Court on Monday restrained the courts from releasing from jail the accused who had duped a 72-year-old woman advocate of the top court of Rs 3.29 crore through 'digital arrest' fraud.

title: India-US Trade Deal 'Nearing Closure,' Set To Address Tariff Issue: Official
content: The first phase of the proposed India-US bilateral trade agreement (BTA) is 'nearing closure' and would address the hefty 50 per cent tariffs imposed by the Trump administration on Indian goods.

title: Every Failed Relationship Cannot Be Criminalised: Tamil Nadu Court
content: The Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court has quashed rape proceedings against a man accused of having sexual intercourse with a woman on the alleged false promise of marriage.

title: India Poised To Gain From New US Tariff Exemptions On Key Agricultural Goods
content: India is expected to gain from the US decision to roll back reciprocal tariffs on certain agricultural products such as tea, coffee and spices, the commerce ministry said on Monday.

title: Video: Man Carrying Knife Attacks Taxi Drivers At Bengaluru Airport
content: A man has been arrested for allegedly attempting to attack two taxi drivers with a knife following a quarrel between them at the Kempegowda International Airport here, police said on Monday.

title: "Don't Care": What's Next For Epstein Files After Trump's Social Media Posts
content: The House is heading towards a vote on a bill to force the Justice Department to release the case files it has collected on the late financier Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Explained: 'D-Voters' In Assam's Special Summary Revision Before Elections
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has announced a special summary revision (SR) of electoral rolls in Assam, separate from the ongoing special intensive revision (SIR) exercise whose groundwork is set in 12 other states.

title: Maharashtra To Use AI, Drones For Surveillance To Curb Leopard Attacks
content: Amid growing concerns over leopard sightings and attacks, Maharashtra Forest Minister on Monday said the government has intensified its efforts to curb the menace by using AI-based alert systems, additional cages, and drone surveillance..

title: South Korean Woman Sexually Assaulted By Physiotherapist In Gurugram: Cops
content: A 55-year-old South Korean woman was allegedly sexually assaulted by a physiotherapist at his clinic in Sector 53 here, police said on Monday.

title: Projecting Tuesday's CFP top 12: Where do the Sooners and Tide land?
content: the college football playoff selection committee's third ranking is guaranteed to look different Tuesday night . the biggest question is how the two-loss teams will stack up . assuming the committee rewards Oklahoma's head-to-head win against the Tide, the duo will likely be a package deal .

title: Will your team make the playoffs? Simulate the rest of the regular season
content: Loading Playoff Seeds 1st Seed Denver Proj:   9-2 7th Seed Jacksonville Proj:   6-4 2nd Seed New England Proj:   9-2 6th Seed Los Angeles Proj:   7-4 3rd Seed Indianapolis Proj:   8-2 5th Seed Buffalo Proj:   7-3 4th Seed Pittsburgh Proj:   6-4 1st Seed Philadelphia Proj:   8-2 7th Seed San Francisco Proj:   7-4 2nd Seed Los Angeles Proj:   8-2 6th Seed Green Bay Proj:   6-3-1 3rd Seed Chicago Proj:   7-3 5th Seed Seattle Proj:   7-3 4th Seed Tampa Bay Proj:   6-4 See what the latest playoff picture looks like and simulate your own playoff scenarios! title: Modern classics: 25 of the best kits from the 21st century
content: the 1990s still reign supreme as the decade with the most enduring and sought-after retro football shirts . since the year 2000 we have seen some timeless entries into the jersey hall of fame . as we approach the end of 2025, we've assembled 25 of the best original kits released by top clubs from leagues all over the world .

title: 30 teams, seven tiers, one clear title favorite: How the league stacks up
content: the rest of the top five teams in net rating are now the contenders we expect . a bottom tier has separated itself, with fans and executives dreaming of snagging a top prospect . all season long, ESPN's Zach Kram and Kevin Pelton will be sorting the 30 teams into tiers .

title: ☔ 'Game, blouses': Bears' jab at Vikes tops trolls
content: the Chicago Bears defeated the Minnesota Vikings 19-17 . the Bears now have five games-winning drives in the fourth quarter . they are tied for the most in a season by a Bears quarterback since the 1970 merger .

title: Jets bench struggling QB Fields, to start Taylor
content: new york Jets coach Aaron Glenn has benched starting quarterback Justin Fields . the 36-year-old will start against the Baltimore Ravens on sunday . fields passed for only 116 yards in the Jets' 27-14 loss to the new England Patriots last week .

title: Week 12 Power Rankings: Oklahoma jumps into top 10; three new teams join the list
content: Texas still has a path to the College Football Playoff despite three losses . the Aggies left Kyle Field at 10-0 for the first time since 1992 . they have areas to improve as the most important games, including their first appearance since 1992, are ahead .

title: Antonio Brown's journey from All-Pro to criminal defendant
content: former all-pro wide receiver faces up to 30 years in prison . he pleaded not guilty last week and is scheduled for arraignment Monday . the 37-year-old's attorney and the prosecutor raised doubts about the alleged victim's claim that a bullet fired by Bronx was fired .

title: MLB offseason grades: Mariners re-sign Naylor in winter's first big move
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through start of spring training .

title: What do Week 11 games mean for the rest of the season?
content: the 49ers beat the Buccaneers 3-0 in the AFC East on friday . quarterback Josh Allen scored three touchdowns for the bills in the afternoon games . a shootout against the 49er and a rushing touchdown from the 49s led by a quarterback .

title: Free agent pickups: Believe in Brissett to replace your injured QB?
content: the 11th Sunday of the NFL season began with the final international game of the season, as the Miami Dolphins topped the Washington Commanders in Madrid, Spain . much happened in between, including the Buffalo Bills QB Josh Allen accounting for six touchdowns, the Arizona Cardinals quarterback Jacoby Brissett breaking the NFL record with 47 completed passes . we await further clarity on which quarterbacks will be available for Week 12 .

title: Rudra may change how Army operates: Upgrade likely from ‘Cold Start’ to ‘Cold Strike’ doctrine
content: 'Rudra' all-arms brigade under the 12 Konark’ Corps was 'fully validated operationally' during the Akhand Prahar’ drills in the desert sector under the just-concluded Trishul exercise . doctrinal evolution has gained ground after southern Army Command chief lt-general said performance of the brigades under the 'Konark' Corps was "fully valid operationally"

title: UK announces visa ban on nations that refuse to take back their citizens being deported
content: the first countries to face such a ban are angola, Namibia and the Democratic Republic of Congo . they will no longer be granted UK visas unless their govts improve cooperation on removals . the home office says the ban includes embassies failing to process removals paperwork in time and requiring individuals to sign their own documentation .
